title: Tamedbeast
author: Tamedbeast
content: I need the list of the most developing games on the blockchain right now, I think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: CryptoCitizen looking good to be see.The coins is not yet entered a market & still waiting a public sale, due waiting a better market condition. However, they still continue the development and everyone now can get a little sneak peak of the development.The game look awesome, try to look that.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: We might see someday fuck to earn coins lol. I am not fam of such as concept nor interested. Have seen a couple of projects like play to earn, sleep to earn, watch to earn, and so on. But this kind of project doesn't survive a long time. Keep in mind how long they can pay if there is not enough revenue. Many projects promise a lot of things before raising funds. But after launch, they forget about everything and enjoy. Better finds some legit and potential coins that can survive for a long time. Don't run behind of shit coins and lose eventually. Research very well once you are going to invest in any coins. And be careful with brand new projects.

comments.author: Tamedbeast
comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on September 22, 2022, 05:58:41 PMCryptoCitizen looking good to be see.The coins is not yet entered a market & still waiting a public sale, due waiting a better market condition. However, they still continue the development and everyone now can get a little sneak peak of the development.The game look awesome, try to look that.Can you drop me a link to the project's website?

comments.author: bitkanu
comments.body: Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 22, 2022, 04:17:38 PMI need the list of the most developing games on the blockchain right now, I think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.I guess if that must be some projects that at the top from this list https://coinmarketcap.com/view/gaming/The projects with billion marketcap have become the top performance in the blockchain gaming but this must be noted if some of them were not play to earn games. The project like sandbox didn't offer incentives to play its game just like axie infinity or vulcan forged.

comments.author: iv4n
comments.body: Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 23, 2022, 04:21:10 PMQuote from: ryzaadit on September 22, 2022, 05:58:41 PMCryptoCitizen looking good to be see....Can you drop me a link to the project's website?https://cryptocitizen.world/home I think this is the link, but to register and play we need to register on QorpoID, even thou it looks interesting for trying I will think about registering and trying this game.I like the headline, the most developing play to earn games, I wonder if will we see some other suggestions, I don't have time to hangout around and look for new and interesting things as I had before, so I will follow this tread, maybe something nice will appear along the way.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: If you are interested on a possible potential play-to-earn game that is in development or in deployment, you can check this site of Play-to-Earn lists of games.   You can also identify which one is live, in development, and canceled.  It is pretty much a huge collection of Play to Earn games and can be sorted out depending on what you wanted to see or what you are looking.Quote from: iv4n on September 23, 2022, 05:26:49 PMQuote from: Tamedbeast on September 23, 2022, 04:21:10 PMQuote from: ryzaadit on September 22, 2022, 05:58:41 PMCryptoCitizen looking good to be see....Can you drop me a link to the project's website?https://cryptocitizen.world/home I think this is the link, but to register and play we need to register on QorpoID, even thou it looks interesting for trying I will think about registering and trying this game.I like the headline, the most developing play to earn games, I wonder if will we see some other suggestions, I don't have time to hangout around and look for new and interesting things as I had before, so I will follow this tread, maybe something nice will appear along the way.This game is quite good and is accessible even without spending money to initially test the game unlike those money-grab half-baked Pay to Earn games.

comments.author: Psynthax
comments.body: I think it's vulcan forged they keeps making their games better and better with frequent updates, moreover they have elysium that could further make their coin famous in the future it's just matter of bullrun that's gonna come.the rest i think isn't as good as vulcan forged since i don't see any meaningful development, there are indeed some newer gaming project that comes which could show promises even though then again we don't know whether they gonna survive corrections.

comments.author: chaser15
comments.body: Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 22, 2022, 04:17:38 PMI need the list of the most developing games on the blockchain right now, I think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.By what means do you define the word "developing games"? Almost all P2E games are not performing well, especially their market priceBut to give you examples, the majority of WAX protocol-based games are still actively in development today.Try to refer to their Dapps list on their website.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: I'm done with this P2E games since it will take your time so much that in order to earn that said token then unexpectedly there are some players who likes to spam their bots account and take almost everything of the spot just to earn that damn token. But in the end, this kind of play-to-earn games won't last long just like what the reply said above if they can't keep up the revenue then that project will either stop the game or think another way to reduce player from taking too much profit. And not to mention with their fucked up market which is kinda sus since there's more like a lot of manipulation in order to bring the price up.And no I don't recommend them to you OP you will just suffer in the end.

comments.author: Hypnosis00
comments.body: I hope that OP is serious about your goal because for now, P2E platforms are not performing well. In fact, as you can see many gamers are leaving for this because of many scams and useless P2E games. How could you think of risking into this? P2E is now vanishing its good reputation and popularity, it probably sooner or later this will totally put an end. Now, if you are really thinking of earning money, I suggest just invest potential coins like BTC and ETH which you can trust and surely earn profit from them.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 22, 2022, 04:17:38 PMI need the list of the most developing games on the blockchain right now, I think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.Axie Infinity is still in its active development today. Meta teams are now also cheap and you can buy the best one at a lower price. However, SLP seems don't have a chance to experience again another price hype but AXS is good for scalping.Do you consider price as one of the factor on deciding what games to be pick?

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Most of the games that I have followed since last year have already cancelled their plans. Plants vs Undead is no longer existing. Axie is a money sink now that you need to craft items in order to get your axies stronger, and the reward is miniscule. Chumbi valley is meh. There literally isn't any promising P2E projects right now and the scene is looking dry. I have given up on the prospects of P2E in the crypto world, and accepted that maybe the concept needs to 'mature' first before we see a good game that is worth investing our time and money on. P.S., Mir4 is still going strong, but it became more of a serious MMORPG rather than a P2E game.

comments.author: Uang_kartal
comments.body: that's a good idea, while waiting for the market to recover. And it might give you lots of opportunities if you have to buy knick-knacks in the game, especially the presale will certainly make it more affordable. And you will reap the harvest when the market returns again. while playing games, filling time and getting tokens. I think the game responses from other users are quite good about the recommendations given, of course you can also search for yourself and more games here  you can check on the website section on thread. there are still individual projects that you think are impressive

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: 'm glad that I was able to enter Axie before it become huge, so I'm happy with how it turn out to be. But right now, it's down so not sure if there will be something as big as P2E.Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 22, 2022, 04:17:38 PMI think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.Not sure though if this is good money management, just saying. If P2E hype die on the next bull run, and so is your money. Just stick to the basic altcoin market. Maybe you can sleep better at night, instead of putting half of your money wherein the risk is too high for this kind of projects. Anyhow, best of luck if you are going to stick with this strategies, to each its own.

comments.author: hichamito37
comments.body: Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 22, 2022, 04:17:38 PMI need the list of the most developing games on the blockchain right now, I think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.None of the games have worked well till now, I think you should think twice before starting with P2E. Since the market entered winter, I don't have any P2E projects that are playable and worth the investment, previous projects also canceled all plans when the bear market came and P2E projects were no longer profitable, even Axie Infinity announced to close the game because there were no players and could not bring in good profits.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Here is a list of play to earn games https://dappradar.com/rankings/category/gamesSurprisingly Axie infinity is not actually the first on the list. Every platform like Polygon, WAX, BNB Chain, ETH, EOS has its own play to earn. Alien Worlds is at the very top of this rank. Not sure why and Axie is in the 8th position. Hard to find out whether there is really a real community of the games.

comments.author: Fredomago
comments.body: Quote from: Teraboy on September 24, 2022, 05:12:04 PMMy first time to see that someone who wanna go 50% to the metaverse. A bit surprised to see that but it seems like that you are actually aware with the risk for your investment. I think that will give you a huge profit once the market will turn to be bullish again. Mostly of metaverse tokens have been dumping so hard to the bottom priceYou need to have a good patience when you already invested your money, not sure about those projects and as for now I don't have any idea with which projects inside meta are doing great, but basing to what you said, those project who experiencing downfall are good prospect if you believe that there's a good chance of bouncing back.Quote from: virasisog on September 24, 2022, 07:50:41 PMI don't see any developing play to earn games right now. Most of them are actually having a hard time surviving the current market situation that we have. Some of them are drastically using their value so I think they are not worth playing anymore. Others have promised that they will have continuous development but most of them left the game undone when the bearish market happened. Play to earn games' hype isn't as noisy as before so I guess it will still take time for them to have the same hype again. It's true, a lot of play to earn project are having problem surviving with the current market, there are many project that really collapsing and investors are losing their money, it's risky to invest if you are not prepared with each risk that you will going to experience, it's better to wait and do deeper research in each possible projects that you'll going to acquire.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: Tamedbeast on September 22, 2022, 04:17:38 PMI need the list of the most developing games on the blockchain right now, I think 50% of my crypto portfolio will be play to earn games.The best resource where you can keep track of all Play2Earn projects is https://playtoearn.net. And there's a category that's just right for you, https://playtoearn.net/blockchaingames/All-Blockchain/All-Genre/Development/All-Device/All-NFT/All-PlayToEarn/All-FreeToPlay.There you can select a list of projects in various stages, Live, Presale, Alpha, Beta, Development, Cancelled. There's no better resource for analyzing Play2Earn projects, IMHO.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Quote from: Z390 on September 24, 2022, 05:33:22 PMUFO gaming, Star atlas, Illuvium, Gala, etc all these projects are currently developing none stop, It's possible that the next bear market play to earn games will take the lead when it comes to return of investments, it's too early to judge right now but I am slowly accumulating Gala and Illuvium.I read some news about Gala and it’s really interesting how they can implement those developments knowing the decrease of numbers of investors for the the P2E. This can be a good strategy for now to keep buying good projects who are none stop working for their improvements because I’m sure P2E is not fully maximize yet and there’s still a chance for them to rise again. For me, Axie and Gala can be a good option for OP.
